text:
Server Version:	Apache/2.2.22 (Unix) mod_ssl/2.2.22 OpenSSL/1.0.0h mod_jk/1.2.35

With mod_jk 1.2.32 I was able to modify values of workers via web browsers e.g. stopping an worker or disable it.

Starting with mod_jk 1.2.35 (and also 1.2.36) this is not working anymore. I can change the values in the browser and the status page display them correctly and the site is also unavailable, but after refreshing the status page several times (<10s) all worker which I disabled or stopped are active again and serving requests.

Enabling the debug and checking Apache logfiles I see that the change is correct, but without further logging the values are set to original values again like changing the port etc.

using the mod_jk.so from 1.2.32 fix the issue and I can use browser to modify any values I like
creator: vanthieu.tran@delixl.nl
mturk@apache.org
text:
We currently have 1.2.37 in VOTE process that fixes this (and similar) issue.
You can check release candidate from:
http://people.apache.org/~mturk/tomcat-connectors/jk-1.2.37/
I've tested Debian version from its unstable tree (1:1.2.37-1) and stopping, disabling subworkers works fine, but changes for lbfactor still don't propagate.
creator: rash@debian.org.pl

Is this from standard page or from 'Edit this attribute for all members' ?
I presume its later cause I can modify lbfactors when directly editing a worker, so please open a new BZ.
That would be BZ 53762 which was fixed in version 1.2.39.
